name: Champurrado
description: These cold winter nights call for a nice hot mug of champurrado. Champurrado is a pre-Colombian drink made with fresh masa, water, piloncillo, and Mexican chocolate. It is especially good with perfectly tender tamales.

video.name: Champurrado
video.description: How to make delicious champurrado with authentic Mexican hot chocolate.

recipeIngredient: 2 tablillas Hernan Mexican Chocolate  (or (1 Ibarra tablilla))

recipeInstructions.text: Place 3 cups of water, chopped piloncillo, and cinnamon stick in a medium sauce pot and bring to a simmer. Simmer for 1 to 2 minutes or until the piloncillo has completely dissolved.
recipeInstructions.name: Place 3 cups of water, chopped piloncillo, and cinnamon stick in a medium sauce pot and bring to a simmer. Simmer for 1 to 2 minutes or until the piloncillo has completely dissolved.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the Mexican chocolate and continue to simmer and stir until chocolate has completely dissolved, about 3 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the Mexican chocolate and continue to simmer and stir until chocolate has completely dissolved, about 3 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: In the meantime place the masa harina in a large bowl and pour 1 cup of water over the masa. Use your hand to dissolve the masa into the water.
recipeInstructions.name: In the meantime place the masa harina in a large bowl and pour 1 cup of water over the masa. Use your hand to dissolve the masa into the water.

recipeInstructions.text: Pour the masa liquid into the simmering hot chocolate. Stir.
recipeInstructions.name: Pour the masa liquid into the simmering hot chocolate. Stir.

recipeInstructions.text: Simmer for 6 to 8 minutes or until the champurrado has thickened. Serve hot!!
